title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young wizard begins his journey at Hogwarts.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry returns to Hogwarts where a hidden chamber unleashes danger.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry battle's with the evil Half-Blooded Prince with plot twists

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry competes in the dangerous Triwizard Tournament.

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry faces the Ministry’s denial of Voldemort’s return.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A hobbit embarks on a dangerous adventure to reclaim treasure.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Frodo begins his journey to destroy the One Ring with the Fellowship.

title: The Two Towers
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The Fellowship is divided as war with Sauron spreads across Middle-earth.

title: The Return of the King
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The final battle for Middle-earth and Frodo’s quest to Mount Doom.

title: The Silmarillion
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A collection of ancient myths and histories of Middle-earth.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A noble family becomes embroiled in power struggles over the desert planet Arrakis and its valuable spice.

title: Ender’s Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A gifted child is trained in a futuristic military academy to fight an alien race.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A mathematician develops psychohistory to predict the fall of a galactic empire.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A washed-up hacker is hired for a high-stakes mission in a world of AI and cyberspace.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use science and ingenuity to survive.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The iconic vampire Count Dracula preys on London, opposed by Van Helsing and his allies.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates life, only to be haunted by the consequences of his ambition.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family isolated in a haunted hotel faces terrifying visions and madness.

title: The Haunting of Hill House
author: Shirley Jackson
description: A group investigates a mansion with a dark, terrifying history.

title: Bird Box
author: Josh Malerman
description: Survivors must live blindfolded to avoid deadly creatures that cause madness on sight.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, pride, and social class with the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A timeless love story between Noah and Allie, tested by war and circumstance.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A young woman becomes caretaker to a paralyzed man, leading to unexpected love.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A WWII nurse is transported back to 18th-century Scotland, where she finds love and danger.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teenagers with cancer embark on a heart-wrenching love story.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: A guide to building habits that enhance effectiveness in personal and professional life.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
author: Dale Carnegie
description: Timeless principles on improving communication and building better relationships.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A framework for creating good habits, breaking bad ones, and mastering small behaviors.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: Teaches living fully in the present moment as the path to happiness and peace.

title: Think and Grow Rich
author: Napoleon Hill
description: Classic guide to wealth-building through mindset, visualization, and persistence.

title: Charlotte’s Web
author: E.B. White
description: The friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a wise spider named Charlotte.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: A gifted girl with telekinetic powers stands up to cruel adults in her life.

title: Where the Wild Things Are
author: Maurice Sendak
description: A young boy travels to an island of wild creatures who crown him king.

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
author: Eric Carle
description: A colorful story of a caterpillar’s journey to becoming a butterfly.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone*
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The start of Harry Potter’s magical journey at Hogwarts.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A comedic yet profound tale of an aging man who imagines himself a knight on chivalrous quests.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping narrative set during Napoleon’s invasion of Russia, exploring love, war, and society.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological study of a man who commits murder and wrestles with guilt and redemption.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A story of justice, redemption, and revolution in 19th-century France, centered on Jean Valjean.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An allegorical journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise, exploring sin, faith, and salvation.

title: The Guns of August
author: Barbara W. Tuchman
description: A Pulitzer Prize–winning account of the opening month of WWI and the decisions that shaped it.

title: Team of Rivals: The Political Genius of Abraham Lincoln
author: Doris Kearns Goodwin
description: Explores how Lincoln brought together political opponents to lead the U.S. during the Civil War.

title: The History of the Peloponnesian War
author: Thucydides
description: A detailed chronicle of the conflict between Athens and Sparta in ancient Greece.

title: Genghis Khan and the Making of the Modern World
author: Jack Weatherford
description: Reinterprets Genghis Khan as a visionary leader who reshaped global culture and trade.

title: Postwar: A History of Europe Since 1945
author: Tony Judt
description: A sweeping history of Europe’s transformation after World War II up to the early 21st century.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A guide on building startups through rapid experimentation, validated learning, and adaptability.

title: Good to Great
author: Jim Collins
description: An analysis of why some companies achieve sustained greatness while others do not.

title: The Intelligent Investor
author: Benjamin Graham
description: A timeless guide to value investing and financial principles for long-term success.

title: Zero to One
author: Peter Thiel (with Blake Masters)
description: Insights on creating unique companies that build the future, rather than copying existing models.

title: The Innovator’s Dilemma
author: Clayton M. Christensen
description: Explains how disruptive innovations can topple established companies and reshape industries.

title: Silent Spring
author: Rachel Carson
description: A groundbreaking work that exposed the dangers of pesticides and modern environmental movement.

title: Walden
author: Henry David Thoreau
description: A reflection on simple living in natural surroundings at Walden Pond.

title: Pilgrim at Tinker Creek
author: Annie Dillard
description: A Pulitzer Prize–winning exploration of nature and human existence through detailed observation.

title: A Sand County Almanac
author: Aldo Leopold
description: Classic essays promoting a land ethic and respect for ecosystems.

title: The Hidden Life of Trees
author: Peter Wohlleben
description: Reveals the secret communication and social life of trees in forests.

title: Mastering the Art of French Cooking
author: Julia Child
description: A landmark guide that introduced French cuisine to American home cooks.

title: The Joy of Cooking
author: Irma S. Rombauer
description: One of the most popular all-purpose cookbooks, covering thousands of recipes.

title: Salt, Fat, Acid, Heat
author: Samin Nosrat
description: A best-selling guide that teaches the four essential elements of good cooking.

title: On Food and Cooking: The Science and Lore of the Kitchen
author: Harold McGee
description: A deep dive into the chemistry and history of food and cooking techniques.

title: Plenty
author: Yotam Ottolenghi
description: A celebrated collection of creative vegetarian recipes with Mediterranean influences.
